results.title: Human instinct. Ep. 2. Deepest desires
results.creator_credit: BBC, TLC Films and Natasha Bondy
results.brief_description: Robert Winston presents this series that looks into what it means to be human: the instincts we have and why we behave the way we do. This episode in the “Human instinct” series looks at our sexual instinct, why men and women are drawn to each other to have sex and procreate. It looks at the different qualities men and women seek in a partner’s appearance and the role of smell in selecting the right genetic match for future children. Attitudes towards casual sex are also touched on as well as the physical changes that take place when we are attracted to someone. Features interviews with a man who discovered he wasn’t the biological father of his children and the actions of a man who wreaked damage when his jealousy was aroused. Long-term couples speak briefly of why their love has endured. Male sexual jealousy is also discussed.

results.title: Human instinct. Ep. 1. Born to survive
results.creator_credit: BBC, TLC Films and Natasha Bondy
results.brief_description: Robert Winston presents this series that looks into what it means to be human: the instincts we have and why we behave the way we do. Part one looks at the most basic instinct of all, the one that we are born with - to survive the trials of life. The program looks at studies on human babies utilising the only means they have at their disposal, crying. Our universal fear of snakes and the inability to overcome it is also examined, as well as food cravings, the important role of taste as a life saving sense and adrenalin to the fight or flight response - graphically illustrated through a volunteer who ran with the bulls at Pamplona, rigged up with medical equipment to represent his physical reaction. Winston also spends time talking to a woman completing studies on degrees of disgust and how it relates to instinct.

results.title: Human heredity. - [Rev. ed.]
results.brief_description: Illustrates the basic concepts of heredity in an easily understandable context. The mechanism whereby human characteristics are passed from generation to generation is discussed. The function of chromosomes, genes, and DNA in the heredity pattern is explained. Also considers the influence of temperament, behaviour and mutation.

results.title: Human growth. - 3rd ed.
results.brief_description:
Compares the physical and sexual development of boys and girls from birth through adolescence. Discusses attitudes towards growing up and having a family.
Suitable for upper primary, lower secondary and teacher levels.

results.title: Human growth. - 2nd ed.
results.brief_description: Uses animation to present elementary facts of human growth and reproduction, and the differences between boys and girls in the rate of maturation. Describes the glands which control physical and sexual activity, the male and female sex organs, menstruation, fertilization, pregnancy and birth. Includes class-room scenes in which a teacher discusses questions which arise following the viewing of animated sequences.

results.title: Human growth
results.brief_description: A mixed group of teenage students in a classroom situation view and discuss an animated film on the subject of human reproduction. By its personal approach, the film overcomes the embarrassment and restraint which is often associated with lectures on sex education.

results.title: Human development: conception to neonate. Reducing risk factors
results.brief_description: This program looks at the parental behaviour which can reduce the incidences of birth defects and low birth weight. The factors which contribute to to birth defects and the consquences for parents and society are examined. The program concentrates on factors which are preventable, primarily through changes in lifestyle.

results.title: Human development: conception to neonate. Pregnancy
results.brief_description: Follows a couple through their pregnancy from conception until birth. Describes their emotional and psychological reactions and the physical changes that occur in both the mother and the foetus. Discusses the developmental tasks that confront the couple as they await the birth of their first child.

Discusses the developmental tasks that confront the couple as they await the birth of their first child.

results.title: Human development: conception to neonate. Birth and the newborn
results.brief_description: Begins by contrasting today’s birth experience with that of 30 years ago. Describes family sensitive birth practices and initial interactions between parents and newborn. Discusses the physical care of the neonate immediately after birth. Describes common characteristics of the neonate including fontanelles and innate reflexes.

results.title: Human beginnings
results.creator_credit: Eddie Albert Productions and University of Oregon
results.brief_description: The film opens showing a class of six-year-old boys and girls working out, through drawing and clay models, their ideas of how a baby grows inside its mother. Each child holds up their drawing and explains to the others what it means to them. The film indicates that all the children have a sound basic idea about human growth and the value of discussion with caring adults.
